task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table by perceiving it, aligning the gripper, and grasping securely.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robotic manipulator tasked to pick a red object from a table. The sequence begins with perception to detect the red object, followed by precise approach, alignment, and execution of a top-down grasp. The environment includes the red object and blue tape markers on a black table, as well as the robotâ€™s parallel-jaw gripper. The plan ensures robust perception and manipulation, retrying visual detection, and verifies a successful grasp.
preconditions: Red object is present and placed on table within workspace.
Robot gripper is empty and operational.
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible.
If not visible, scan using raster pattern up to 3 attempts.
Detect the red object and localize precisely.
Move gripper above the red object with safety offset.
Approach and align with the red object.
Verify red object is secured in gripper.
success_criteria: Red object is lifted from the table and stably held in gripper.
failure_and_recovery: If object not found, re-scan up to 3 times.
If grasp fails, episode ends (no retry specified).
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends on successful grasp and object detected in gripper, or if perception fails after all attempts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Check if red object is visible
Raster scan to locate red object, retrying up to 3 times
Move gripper above red object with 5cm offset
Compute top-down grasp pose for red object
Approach and align gripper with red object, tolerance 0.005
Grasp at computed pose using top strategy
Verify red object is in gripper

failure_modes: Red object not detected within timeout or scan attempts
Grasp fails or object not secured
recovery_strategy: Retry scan for up to 3 attempts if perception fails
No explicit recovery on grasp failure in this episode
assumptions: No placement action needed, as per visual evidence frames [0]-[8]: the red object is only picked and lifted, not placed.
Red object is unobstructed throughout the sequence.
No explicit force or timing instruction; using typical moderate bins.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is lifted from table and fully leaves the surface while in gripper
